subject: p16826047
History: PleurX catheter, history of effusion with worsening shortness of breath, assess interval change.
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest provided. Port-A-Cath is unchanged in position with its tip positioned in the expected location of the mid SVC. A right pleural drain is in place with increased opacity in the right lung and probable increase in size of the loculated right pleural effusion. Findings are concerning for a superimposed consolidation/pneumonia. The left lung remains essentially clear. The heart is difficult to assess given the effacement of the right heart border. The prominence of the mediastinum may reflect in part adjacent loculated pleural fluid. No pneumothorax is seen.
Impression: Increased right pleural loculated effusion with chest tube in place. Increasing consolidation in the right lung is concerning for pneumonia.
